intro: Epimenidion undulatum, commonly known as the wavy epimenidion, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves with a wavy margin, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in late summer. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
